sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
Suppose that \(k \), \(l \), \(p \), and \(q \) are in proportion. Now prove that, 
\[	
	\frac{(k - l )^3}{(l - p )^3} = \frac{k }{q } \text{ and, }
\]
\[
	\sqrt{kl } + \sqrt{lp } - \sqrt{pq } = \sqrt{(k + l - p )(l + p - q )}
\]
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "$$\text{
 
It is given that $k $, $l $, $p $, and $q $ are in proportion.}$$
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{k }{l } = \frac{l }{p } = \frac{p }{q } = r \textrm{ (assume)}
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow p = rq 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow l = rp = r ^2 q 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow k = rl = r ^3 q 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
Now, for the first equation, left hand side of the equation can be written as 
\[
	\textrm{LHS } = \frac{(k - l )^3}{(l - p )^3}
\]
\[
	= \frac{(r ^3 q - r ^2 q )^3}{(r ^2 q - rq )^3}
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	= \frac{(r ^2 q (r - 1))^3}{(rq (r - 1))^3}
\]
\[
	= r ^3
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
Right hand side of the equation can be written as
\[
	\frac{k }{q } = \frac{r ^3 q }{q } = r ^3 
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "$$\text{
From the above two expressions, we can write that LHS $=$ RHS.

Now, for the second equation, on left hand side we have}
\[
	\textrm{LHS } = \sqrt{kl } + \sqrt{lp } - \sqrt{pq }
\]
\[
	= \sqrt{r ^3 q r ^2 q } + \sqrt{r ^2 q rq } - \sqrt{rq q }
\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	= q \sqrt{ r } (r ^2 + r - 1)
\]"}, {"id": "s8", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
Now, right hand side of the equation becomes
\[
	\textrm{RHS } = \sqrt{(k + l - p )(l + p - q )}
\]
\[
	= \sqrt{(r ^3 q + r ^2 q - rq ) (r ^2 q + rq - q )}
\]"}, {"id": "s9", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	= \sqrt{rq (r ^2 + r - 1) q (r ^2 + r - 1)}
\]
\[
	= q \sqrt{r } (r ^2 + r - 1)
\]"}, {"id": "s10", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "$$\text{
From the above two expressions, we can observe that LHS $=$ RHS.

Hence proved.
\newline
}$$
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": "$$\text{After assumption $\frac{k }{l } = \frac{l }{p } = \frac{p }{q } = r$ and taking terms separately we get $p = rq$}$$ "}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Similarly, for $l$ and $k$ we get $l = rp = r ^2 q$ and $k = rl = r ^3 q$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Substituting the value of $k$, $l$ and $p$ in the LHS, we get $\frac{(r ^3 q - r ^2 q )^3}{(r ^2 q - rq )^3}$}$$ "}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Upon further simplification, we get $\frac{(r ^2 q (r - 1))^3}{(rq (r - 1))^3}= r ^3$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Putting the value of $k$ in RHS, we get $\frac{k }{q } = \frac{r ^3 q }{q } = r ^3$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Putting the value of $k$, $l$, and $p$ in LHS we get $\sqrt{r ^3 q r ^2 q } + \sqrt{r ^2 q rq } - \sqrt{rq q }$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Further simplification will get us the result $q \sqrt{ r } (r ^2 + r - 1)$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Putting the value of $k$, $l$, and $p$ in the RHS we get $\sqrt{(r ^3 q + r ^2 q - rq ) (r ^2 q + rq - q )}$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Further simplification will give us the result as $q \sqrt{r } (r ^2 + r - 1)$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
